item.title: ‘Alchemy x roguelike RPG’ Alchemia Rogue: Mia and the Mystery Labyrinth announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
Limeleaf Games has announced Alchemia Rogue: Mia and the Mystery Labyrinth, an “alchemy x roguelike RPG” coming to PC via Steam and Epic Games Store in 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via Limeleaf Games:

About

Mia, an apprentice alchemist, sets out on her journey in this “alchemy x roguelike RPG.”

Grid-based, turn-based exploration meets a deep alchemy system where you combine materials to transmute powerful items—adding new layers of strategy to the traditional roguelike experience.

Key Features

  • Ever-Changing Dungeons
    • Each time you enter, everything changes—terrain, materials, and monster placement create a new and mysterious dungeon to explore.
    • Carefully choose each action in the grid-based, turn-based system.
    • When you fall, items and levels obtained during that run are lost. Embrace the tension and excitement of each adventure!
  • The Key to Adventure: Alchemy
    • Dungeons are filled with alchemical materials—herbs, mushrooms, ores, and more!
    • Find an Alchemy Spring and seize the chance to transmute. What will you transmute with your limited resources? Your skill as an alchemist will be put to the test.
    • Use the powerful items you’ve transmuted to push deeper into the dungeon!
    • As Mia continues to practice alchemy, she’ll gain new recipes and unlock even more powerful transmutations. Expand your world of alchemy and create even stronger items with each attempt.
  • Enhancing Equipment through Alchemy
    • At the Alchemy Spring, you can also enhance your weapons and armor using materials.
    • Evolve weapons to increase attack power or reinforce armor to boost defense—nurture your favorite equipment and make it your own!
    • Enhanced equipment is never lost, even if you fall. Strengthen yourself step by step, and the path to conquering the dungeon will open before you!
  • Unique Monsters Await
    • Even the cutest-looking monsters shouldn’t be underestimated. They’ll poison you, steal your items, and put you to sleep—each with its own tricky abilities waiting to test your wits!
    • Observe their traits and discover the right way to counter them!
  • High-Difficulty Dungeons to Test Your Skill
    • Challenge a special dungeon where no items can be brought in.
    • Both your alchemy skills and equipment enhancements start from scratch, offering a fresh and unpredictable adventure each time.
    • Use your knowledge, instincts, and a touch of luck to overcome the ultimate trial!

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Shadowgate VR: The Mines of Mythrok coming to PS VR2 on November 25
item.content:encoded:
• PS VR2
  • PS5

Currently available for SteamVR and Quest.

Publisher Andromeda Entertainment and developer Zojoi will release virtual reality dungeon crawler Shadowgate VR: The Mines of Mythrok for PlayStation VR2 on November 25, the companies announced.

Shadowgate VR: The Mines of Mythrok first launched for Quest on October 7, 2021, followed by SteamVR on June 17, 2022.

Here is a brief overview of the game:

Shadowgate has a long history on PlayStation, appearing across generations as one of gaming’s most iconic first-person adventures. Now the series steps into a new era with its debut on PlayStation VR2.

Shadowgate VR: The Mines of Mythrok takes players deep into a lost dwarven kingdom, armed with a wand and shield to master elemental magic, solve ancient puzzles, and face towering guardians. Guided by Odin, your sharp-tongued raven companion, you’ll ride breakneck minecarts, outwit deadly traps, and uncover secrets hidden far beneath the stone.

On PlayStation VR2, the adventure gains a new level of immersion with eye-tracked spellcasting, adaptive triggers, Sense controller haptics, headset rumble, and 120 hertz performance with no reprojection. It’s the classic dungeon crawl reimagined for virtual reality, and it arrives November 25.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/shadowgate-vr-the-mines-of-mythrok-coming-to-ps-vr2-on-november-25

item.title: Audio Trip coming to PS VR2 on November 11
item.content:encoded:
• PS VR2
  • PS5

Virtual reality rhythm game comes to PlayStation.

Publisher Flat2VR Studios and developer Kinemotik Studios will release virtual reality rhythm game Audio Trip for PlayStation VR2 on November 11, the companies announced.

Audio Trip first launched for PC on October 1, 2019, followed by Rift on October 24, 2019, and Quest on May 7, 2020.

Here is a brief overview of the game:

Revealed today for the very first time on PlayStation VR2, Audio Trip turns your play space into your own personal dance floor. Every move is handcrafted by a professional choreographer, so when you catch gems, glide along ribbons, or smash drums, it all flows perfectly with the music. Nothing is randomized or auto-generated. It feels like you’re dancing inside the song.

With more than 120 levels across 32 tracks, plus playlists, cardio routines, and achievements to chase, there’s always a new way to play. And if that’s not enough, the built-in choreography editor lets the community create and share routines, keeping the library fresh with fan-made content.

On PlayStaiton VR2, the game takes advantage of HDR, headset rumble, and eye-tracked foveated rendering to keep visuals sharp and the beat immersive. Whether you’re here for fitness, flow-state dancing, or just to nail the moves to “Gangnam Style,” Audio Trip delivers rhythm gameplay at its most creative.

item.title: VRacer Hoverbike now available for PS VR2
item.content:encoded:
• PS VR2
  • PS5

Virtual reality racing game makes PlayStation debut.

Publisher Flat2VR Studios and developer VertexBreakers have released virtual reality racing game VRacer Hoverbike for PlayStation VR2 for $29.99, the companies announced.

VRacer Hoverbike first launched for Rift on June 26, 2019, followed by QUest on June 26, 2025, and SteamVR on June 30, 2025.

Here is a brief overview of the game:

Start your engines PlayStation VR2 gamers, VRacer Hoverbike is here. A native arcade racer built for virtual reality, it captures the pure sensation of speed inside a headset. Every turn is controlled by leaning your body, matching the movement of your bike on screen, so the rush feels intuitive and physical without any motion sickness.

With 30 tracks, multiple game modes, and online cross-platform multiplayer, there’s plenty to master. And thanks to PlayStation VR2 features like HDR visuals, adaptive triggers, and headset rumble, every race is sharper, smoother, and more immersive than ever. After years of refinement since its initial debut, VRacer Hoverbike has finally found its perfect track on PlayStation VR2.
